text: Phenylpiracetam hydrazide, also known as fonturacetam hydrazide, is a racetam that is a derivative of phenylpiracetam in which the amide group is replaced with a hydrazide group. It was first reported by a Russian research group in 1980 as part of a series of chemical compounds investigated as anticonvulsants. In an electroshock test it was found to have an ED50 of 310 mg/kg. ==See also== * Piracetam ==References== Category:Acetamides Category:Designer drugs Category:Hydrazides Category:Racetams Category:Anticonvulsants
title: Phenylpiracetam hydrazide
